attributes.action: Make it illegal for misleading headlines on news coverage on health and wellness
attributes.additional_details:
eg: VAPE ALERT E-cigarette users warned ‘stop vaping NOW’ as FIFTH person dies of mysterious lung condition : https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/9881839/e-cigarette-stop-vaping-lung-condition-deaths/
This in our opinion SHOULD have been headlined: 'VAPE ALERT E-cigarette users warned 'stop vaping black market THC cartridges as 5th person dies '
attributes.background: Our aim is to stop the media scaring people with unfactual headlines. Many don't read full articles and as a nation we are misinformed. If the news is headlined correctly from the beginning, people will be able to make better decisions based on truth. Vaping is a prime example of media slander.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the day-to-day regulation of media content.  You can find more information about IPSO, the independent regulator, here:

https://www.ipso.co.uk/complain/
